name: awesome-minidocs
description: Automatically make a minidocs site from a awesome-repo. Pretty hacky and very WIP.

scripts.build:deploy: npm run build:css && minidocs docs -c docs/contents.json -i awesome-dat -o dist -l ./node_modules/dat-design/public/img/dat-data-logo.svg -t 'Dat World' -s assets/styles.css --full-html
scripts.build: npm run build:css && minidocs docs -c docs/contents.json -i awesome-dat -o dist -l ./node_modules/dat-design/public/img/dat-data-logo.svg -t 'Dat World' -s assets/styles.css --pushstate
scripts.update: npm run update:list && npm run update:build
scripts.update:list: echo clkao/awesome-dat | ecosystem-docs sync && echo clkao/awesome-dat | ecosystem-docs read | node list.js
scripts.update:build: cat repos.txt | ecosystem-docs sync && cat repos.txt | ecosystem-docs read | node build.js
scripts.deploy: npm run build:deploy && echo awesome.datproject.org > dist/CNAME && gh-pages -d dist

author: Joe Hand <joe@hand.email> (https://joeahand.com/)
